message:
With the first government shutdown in 15 years looming as a real possibility, the White House is making contingency plans. With the first government shutdown in 15 years looming as a real possibility, the White House, no matter what it says, will need to prepare.

‎"When the Clinton-GOP standoff led to shutdowns, the public felt the impact in a variety of ways. All 368 national parks, museums & monuments were closed & roughly 200,000 passport applications went untouched... Veterans’ benefit checks were delayed & new Social Security claims were not registered. An estimated 800,000 federal employees were furloughed for 5 days in 1995..."

http://thehill.com/homenews/administration/145617-white-house-will-need-to-prepare-for-shutdown
